benchmark_details.name: XL-AlpacaEval
benchmark_details.overview: XL-AlpacaEval is a cross-lingual evaluation benchmark built to assess the performance of large language models in the task of cross-lingual open-ended generation. It evaluates whether models can generate coherent responses in a target language different from the one in which the query is posed.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the current state of cross-lingual open-ended generation capabilities of large language models and to provide a structured benchmark for improvement.

data.source: XL-AlpacaEval is adapted from the original AlpacaEval dataset, which consists of multi-domain prompts filtered for suitability in cross-lingual contexts.
data.annotation: Manually verified and filtered prompts to ensure they are suitable for eliciting cross-lingual responses.

methodology.calculation: Win rates are determined by comparing model outputs against a baseline reference model.
methodology.interpretation: Higher win rates indicate better performance in generating responses that humans prefer over baseline responses.
methodology.baseline_results: Win rates against GPT-4o-mini across multiple languages.
methodology.validation: Live evaluation using multiple reference models and feedback from human evaluators.
